attributes.title: Siddha Tradition: States of Consciousness - Nithyananda Morning Satsang (19 Nov 2010) Message
attributes.description:
Paramahamsa Nithyananda began his discourse with something that happened to him this morning in the pancha tapas meditation for peace.  "I was experiencing a extraordinary strong awareness not just in my nervous system in it is always there, I was experiencing it all over! I can say it is one of the important revelation happened in me -- the highest utility of the body is to experience the pure witnessing consciousness in the body. That is the highest utility, highest possibility, best thing that can happen to the human body."
He expanded on this concept with three truths:
1. The highest utility reason for the body is to radiate and be the center of the pure awareness.
2. In front of the pure awareness all possibilities are dancing. When you go and live among the different civilizations only you will understand each civilization is a different world all together. So in front of pure awareness, all dances are going on. Whichever dance you pick up and whatever idea you will give more awareness you will assume that kind of awareness and tuning.
3. The changing of the tuning does not happen only when you take new bodies. It happens even while you fall asleep and lie down in the night and daytime. Each time you fall asleep more than 4 hrs, 3 ½ ideas about yourself are removed and you have chance to put new ones or get the same old 3 ½  ideas or even more dangerous  ones. So every day you either grow or go down! 

Human life is a great possibility, a very great possibility, and Swamiji is telling us these are some of the very deep secrets. He will begin talking on states of consciousness in the siddha tradition and techniques and herbs used to infuse that state of consciousness into human beings. 
In the vedic tradition there are four states of consciousness. In the siddha tradition they work on one more state called 'turiyateetha.' They are: 

1. Jagrath -- waking state

2. Swapna -- dream state

3. Sushupthi -- Deep sleep state

4. Turiya -- in the deep sleep sometime you go to that depth where you touch the restful awareness; is like a satori.

5. Turiyateeta -- means being established in that turiya state forever; is like a nithya samadhi, eternal Samadhi.

He asked us all to understand this much now - Jagrath or waking state is a state where you can understand, analyze, accept and you will have ability to shift yourself to all the 5 states and overlapping of all the 5 states on to each other.
He ended with this blessing, "Let the grace of siddhas be with all of us to experience the highest state of consciousness through the understanding of different states. Blessings!"
Paramahamsa Nithyananda is a living enlightened master and a rare incarnation, an avatar who is the spiritual force for our millennium. He has inspired over 4 million lives worldwide to a new conscious age of enlightened living and has healed many thousands from chronic diseases and mental problems & traumas. The most watched and most popular spiritual teacher on Youtube globally with over 7000 hours of discourses, he has dedicated his life and the spiritual mission with over 1200 full-time volunteers to teach the science of enlightenment. 

 

His spiritual teachings, life solutions and meditation workshops are the extraordinary works of a Spiritual Genius. 'Inner Awakening' is his ultimate offering to create a New Man - a 21 days enlightenment intensive program for a permanent breakthrough in consciousness and to experience living enlightenment, a conflict-free life. Thousands from around the planet are experiencing their Inner Awakening with total physical wellbeing, deep emotional healing, release from past life traumas, DNA reprogramming and actualizing their limitless potential by transcending into a zone of bliss. Go to www.innerawakening.org or www.dhyanapeetam.org to begin your extraordinary way of existing this Dec2010!
